data.title: Captain America: Brave New World
authors: Contributors to Marvel Cinematic Universe Wiki
data.meta_description: Captain America: Brave New World is an upcoming superhero film, based on the Marvel Comics superhero of the same name. data.text:
"Let this man cook."

This article belongs to an upcoming Marvel Cinematic Universe product and all of its content is subject to change. Additional information will be added as it becomes available.

Captain America: Brave New World is an upcoming superhero film, based on the Marvel Comics superhero of the same name. The film is a sequel to Captain America: The Winter Soldier, Captain America: Civil War, and The Falcon and The Winter Soldier. It is the thirty-fifth film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, and the fourteenth installment of Phase Five. The film is set to be released on February 14, 2025.

The film is directed by Julius Onah and stars Anthony Mackie as Sam Wilson/Captain America, Danny Ramirez as Joaquín Torres/Falcon, Shira Haas as Ruth Bat-Seraph,[6] Xosha Roquemore, Carl Lumbly as Isaiah Bradley, Giancarlo Esposito as Seth Voelker/Sidewinder, Liv Tyler as Betty Ross, Tim Blake Nelson as Samuel Sterns/Leader, and Harrison Ford as Thaddeus Ross/Red Hulk.

Synopsis[]

After meeting with newly elected U.S. President Thaddeus Ross, Sam finds himself in the middle of an international incident. He must discover the reason behind a nefarious global plot before the true mastermind has the entire world seeing red.[7]

Production[]

On April 23, 2021, The Hollywood Reporter reported that a fourth Captain America film was in development with Malcolm Spellman and Dalan Musson set to write the script. It was also reported that Anthony Mackie would likely reprise his role as Sam Wilson/Captain America in the film.[1]

On August 18, 2021, Deadline reported that Anthony Mackie had closed a deal to star in the film.[19] That same day, it was reported that the film would begin production in May 2022 in Atlanta.[20]

On July 8, 2022, The Hollywood Reporter reported that Julius Onah would be directing the film.[21]

On July 23, 2022, at San Diego Comic-Con 2022, Kevin Feige announced that a fourth Captain America film titled Captain America: New World Order was in development. He also announced that the film would be released on May 3, 2024.[22]

On September 10, 2022, at D23 Expo 2022, Kevin Feige announced that Carl Lumbly, Danny Ramirez and Tim Blake Nelson would be reprising their roles as Isaiah Bradley, Joaquín Torres and Samuel Sterns/Leader, respectively, in the film. He also announced that Shira Haas had joined the cast of the film and that she would portray Ruth-Bat Seraph/Sabra.[23] That same day, Danny Ramirez confirmed that Joaquín Torres would become the new Falcon in the film.[24]

On October 13, 2022, /Film reported that Harrison Ford had joined the cast of the film and that he would portray Thaddeus Ross, succeeding the late William Hurt.[25] Four days later, Deadline confirmed Ford's casting.[5]

On October 20, 2022, it was reported that the working title of the film was "Rochelle Rochelle".[26]

On October 22, 2022, it was reported that the film was scheduled to start production on March 20, 2023 and wrap on June 30 in Atlanta.[27]

On October 31, 2022, in an interview with Collider, Nate Moore revealed that he would be producing the film.[28]

On January 5, 2023, it was revealed that Kramer Morgenthau had joined the film as the cinematographer.[29]

On January 20, 2023, Deadline reported that Xosha Roquemore had joined the cast of the film in an undisclosed key role.[30]

On February 23, 2023, during an interview on Jimmy Kimmel Live!, Anthony Mackie revealed that the film would start production on March 1.[31]

On March 21, 2023, it was reported that the film had begun production.[13]

On March 22, 2023, the Motion Picture Association reported that Sebastian Stan would be reprising his role as Bucky Barnes/Winter Soldier in the film.[32]

On March 27, 2023, The Hollywood Reporter reported that Liv Tyler would be reprising her role as Betty Ross in the film.[33]

On May 16, 2023, it was revealed that Seth Rollins had joined the cast of the film in an undisclosed role.[11]

On May 24, 2023, it was reported that Rosa Salazar had joined the cast of the film and that she would portray Rachel Leighton/Diamondback.[9]

On June 6, 2023, it was announced that the film had been retitled from Captain America: New World Order to Captain America: Brave New World.[34][35] That same day, it was reported that Julius Onah had co-written the film's script, replacing Dalan Musson.[3]

On June 13, 2023, it was announced that the film had been pushed back from its initial release date to July 26, 2024.[36]

On June 30, 2023, Kramer Morgenthau revealed that the film had wrapped production.[37]

On November 9, 2023, it was announced that the film had been pushed back from its July 26, 2024 release date to February 14, 2025.[38]

On December 13, 2023, Deadline reported that Matthew Orton would write additional scenes and material for the film's additional photography, which was set to take place in the spring-summer of 2024.[2]

On March 20, 2024, in an interview with RadioTimes.com, Anthony Mackie revealed that Sebastian Stan would not be reprising his role as Bucky Barnes/Winter Soldier in the film.[39]

On May 31, 2024, The Hollywood Reporter reported that Giancarlo Esposito had joined the cast of the film in an undisclosed role during reshoots.[40]

On July 12, 2024, The Hollywood Reporter revealed that Shira Haas' character would not be referred to as Sabra when the film was released and would instead be referred to by her given name of Ruth Bat-Seraph, as a means to address the negative connotations attached to the name amidst the backlash and calls for a boycott that the film received following the initial Sabra announcement.[6]

On July 27, 2024, at San Diego Comic-Con 2024, Giancarlo Esposito revealed that he would portray Seth Voelker/Sidewinder in the film.[8]

On August 9, 2024, at D23, Laura Karpman revealed that she would compose the score for the film.[4]
